description: can't find the folder to put my songs in, nor the config file to add my existing Ultrastar Songs folder in. The paths that web forums suggest don't exist

On the Steamdeck, the path is : /home/deck/.ultrastardx
for the config.

Downloaded it on the Steam Deck, Flatpak version.
The instruction written to set songs in /.var/app/eu.usdx.UltraStarDeluxe/.ultrastardx/songs/ was incorrect at least for me, i even had to create the folder mentioned in the instruction.
The correct folder for Steam Deck users and Flatpak version is, at the time of writing, /home/deck/.ultrastardx/songs which is already present in your system when you install it.

Other than that I wasn't able to set an external microphone for the songs (yes it works and is even showed in the UltraStar settings). 

The program is very nice and fun for what I tried, reccommended for those who likes to sing or just have some fun

The software seems to come with no default songs, and the editor requires you type out the filename by menory: No file picker. Last but not least, even if you type ix exactly, it says the file is not found. Completely dysfunctional.

Used it for many years on Windows and was glad to see we have a working version for Linux, I noticed no difference so far. One important thing is the songs need to be placed in the folder indicated in the description - creating a symbolic link like I was trying before does not work.
Works Perfectly like the installation from source. Love it.

Esta versión detecta correctamente el micrófono y las notas, a diferencia del WorlParty. Lo único "malo" es que no detecta las carpetas que tengas en la carpeta Songs, auque si es posible hacer que se ordenen las canciones de acuerdo a ese orden. Tengo Ubuntu 22.04.
